target_translation: tri kỷ / người đồng điệu
source_translation: a person whose interests or attitudes are similar to one's own
example: I knew from our first conversation that we were kindred spirits.

target_translation: xa cách dần / nhạt nhòa dần
source_translation: to gradually become less friendly and eventually lose contact
example: After university, we started drifting apart as we moved to different cities.

target_translation: cùng tần số / bắt sóng được nhau
source_translation: thinking in a similar way and understanding each other well
example: It's great to work with someone who is on the same wavelength.

target_translation: đồng quan điểm / thống nhất
source_translation: to agree with someone; to have the same opinion
example: My father and I don't always see eye to eye on politics.
collocations: see eye to eye with someone

target_translation: xây dựng cầu nối / hàn gắn
source_translation: to improve relationships between people or groups that are very different or do not like each other
example: The local government is trying to build bridges between the different ethnic communities.

target_translation: sự xích mích / mâu thuẫn
source_translation: disagreement or conflict between people or groups with different ideas or personalities
example: There is a lot of friction between the two departments over the new budget.

target_translation: bạn lúc vui có nhau (lúc khó thì mất hút)
source_translation: a person who is only a friend when things are going well for you
example: I thought he was a true friend, but he turned out to be a fair-weather friend.

term: get on like a house on fire
ipa: /ɡet ɒn laɪk ə haʊs ɒn ˈfaɪər/
target_translation: vừa gặp đã thân / rất hợp nhau
source_translation: to become friends very quickly and have a very friendly relationship
example: I introduced my two best friends and they got on like a house on fire.

target_translation: giảng hòa / gác lại mâu thuẫn
source_translation: to stop an argument and become friends again
example: After years of fighting, the two brothers finally decided to bury the hatchet.

target_translation: sự ủng hộ vô điều kiện
source_translation: help or encouragement given without any limits or conditions
example: My family provided unconditional support while I was studying abroad.

target_translation: áp lực đồng lứa
source_translation: influence from members of one's peer group to act in a certain way
example: Many teenagers start smoking due to peer pressure.

target_translation: bè phái / nhóm lợi ích riêng biệt
source_translation: a small, exclusive group of people who do not readily allow others to join them
example: The high school cafeteria was divided into several small cliques.

target_translation: người hướng ngoại / người quảng giao
source_translation: a person who is socially dynamic, successful at networking, and charasmatic
example: My sister is a real social butterfly; she has friends in every city.
collocations: be a bit of a social butterfly

target_translation: sự rạn nứt / sự ghẻ lạnh
source_translation: the fact of no longer being on friendly terms or part of a social group
example: The dispute led to a long period of estrangement between the two families.

target_translation: tâm sự / giãi bày (tin tưởng)
source_translation: to tell someone about a secret or private matter while trusting them not to repeat it
example: She needed someone to confide in after her difficult breakup.

target_translation: người quen chung
source_translation: someone that two people both know
example: We met through a mutual acquaintance at a wedding last year.

target_translation: cuộc trò chuyện chân tình
source_translation: a candid and intimate conversation
example: We had a long heart-to-heart over coffee and fixed our friendship.

target_translation: chuẩn mực xã hội
source_translation: the unwritten rules of behavior that are considered acceptable in a group or society
example: In some cultures, it is a social norm to remove your shoes before entering a home.

target_translation: gắn kết bởi
source_translation: to develop a close connection based on shared experiences or interests
example: The soldiers were bonded by their shared experiences during the war.

target_translation: có mối quan hệ không tốt / cơm chẳng lành canh chẳng ngọt
source_translation: to have a poor or unfriendly relationship with someone
example: Since the argument, the neighbors have been on bad terms.

target_translation: mối quan hệ trong sáng / thuần khiết
source_translation: a relationship that is purely spiritual or intellectual and not sexual
example: They have a close platonic relationship that has lasted for twenty years.

target_translation: phá tan bầu không khí ngượng ngùng
source_translation: to do or say something to relieve tension or get conversation started in a social situation
example: The host told a funny story to break the ice at the start of the party.

target_translation: tẩy chay / loại ra khỏi nhóm
source_translation: to exclude someone from a society or group
example: He was ostracized by his colleagues after he reported the manager's misconduct.

target_translation: nuôi dưỡng / thúc đẩy một mối quan hệ
source_translation: to encourage the development or growth of a connection
example: Team-building events are designed to foster better working relationships.

target_translation: phép tắc xã giao
source_translation: the customary code of polite behavior in society or among a particular group
example: Knowing proper social etiquette is essential for international business meetings.

target_translation: trung thành
source_translation: giving or showing firm and constant support or allegiance to a person or institution
example: She has been a loyal friend to me since we were toddlers.

target_translation: điểm chung / tiếng nói chung
source_translation: opinions or interests shared by each of two or more parties
example: Despite their political differences, they found common ground in their love for art.

target_translation: cãi nhau và nghỉ chơi với ai đó
source_translation: to have a quarrel and stop being friendly with someone
example: He fell out with his business partner over a financial disagreement.

target_translation: mở rộng vòng bạn bè / quan hệ xã hội
source_translation: to meet more people and make more friends
example: Joining a hobby club is a great way to broaden your social circle.

target_translation: cô độc / thích ở một mình
source_translation: done or existing alone; liking to be alone
example: He enjoys solitary walks in the forest to clear his mind.

target_translation: tâm đầu ý hợp / bắt chuyện rất nhanh
source_translation: to have a good friendly relationship with someone as soon as you meet them
example: We had similar interests in music, so we hit it off immediately.

target_translation: giữ liên lạc
source_translation: to maintain communications with someone
example: Although she moved to London, we still keep in touch via social media.

target_translation: rút ngắn khoảng cách / hàn gắn
source_translation: to reduce the differences between two people or groups
example: The counselor tried to bridge the gap between the parents and their teenage son.

target_translation: yêu xa / mối quan hệ khoảng cách xa
source_translation: a romantic relationship between two people who live far apart
example: Long-distance relationships require a lot of trust and regular communication.

target_translation: quên mất thời gian
source_translation: to be so busy or interested in something that you do not notice the time
example: Whenever I talk to my best friend, we always lose track of time.

target_translation: người hướng nội
source_translation: a shy, reticent person who enjoys spending time alone to recharge
example: As an introvert, he prefers quiet nights at home over loud parties.
collocations: be a bit of an introvert

target_translation: sự giáo dục / sự nuôi dưỡng
source_translation: the way in which a child is cared for and taught how to behave while growing up
example: Her strict upbringing made her a very disciplined adult.

target_translation: hợp với ai đó / có mối quan hệ tốt
source_translation: to have a harmonious or friendly relationship
example: I get along with most of my coworkers, which makes the office a pleasant place.

target_translation: hệ thống hỗ trợ / chỗ dựa (tinh thần)
source_translation: a network of people who provide practical or emotional support
example: Having a strong support system of friends is vital for mental health.

target_translation: mối quan hệ độc hại
source_translation: a relationship characterized by behaviors that are emotionally or physically damaging
example: It took her years to realize she was in a toxic relationship and leave.

target_translation: sự tôn trọng lẫn nhau
source_translation: regard that two people have for each other
example: A healthy marriage is built on a foundation of mutual respect.

target_translation: kẻ tham danh vọng / người thích trèo cao
source_translation: a person who attempts to gain a higher social position or status
example: He was labeled a social climber for only befriending wealthy individuals.

target_translation: duy trì / giữ gìn danh tiếng
source_translation: to maintain the good opinion that people have about you
example: As a doctor, she worked hard to uphold her reputation for excellence.

target_translation: coi ai đó là điều hiển nhiên / thiếu trân trọng
source_translation: to fail to appreciate someone because you are so used to them
example: Don't take your friends for granted; they won't stay forever if they feel unappreciated.

target_translation: vòng bạn bè / nhóm bạn
source_translation: a group of people who are friends with each other
example: She has a small but very loyal circle of friends.

target_translation: mất liên lạc / không còn hiểu rõ thực tế
source_translation: no longer in communication or no longer understanding a situation
example: I've been out of touch with him since we graduated five years ago.
collocations: be out of touch with reality

target_translation: hòa giải / làm lành
source_translation: to restore friendly relations between people
example: It was difficult for the two sisters to reconcile after their inheritance dispute.

target_translation: tình đơn phương
source_translation: love that is not returned or rewarded
example: Many classic novels explore the theme of painful unrequited love.

target_translation: bờ vai để tựa vào / người biết lắng nghe
source_translation: someone who listens to your problems and gives you emotional support
example: I'm always here if you need a shoulder to cry on.
collocations: be a shoulder to cry on
need a shoulder to cry on

target_translation: sự loại trừ xã hội / sự cô lập
source_translation: the process of being shut out from the social, economic, or political systems
example: Poverty often leads to social exclusion and lack of opportunities.
